data.title: Sanaya Irani Opens Up on Casting Couch
data.meta_description: Television actress Sanaya Irani has opened up about her troubling experiences with the casting couch in Bollywood and the South film industry. In interviews, Irani revealed incidents of being asked to wear a bikini for a big Bollywood film, where the director was notably rude and unprofessional. She also recounted a body-shaming episode in the South industry, where she was told they needed a 'fuller' person for a role. Irani expressed frustration with the industry's attitude and the pressure to conform to specific body standards. Her courageous revelations highlight ongoing issues of exploitation and discrimination in the film industry.
data.text:
Television actress Sanaya Irani has opened up about her troubling experiences with the casting couch in Bollywood and the South film industry. In interviews, Irani revealed incidents of being asked to wear a bikini for a big Bollywood film, where the director was notably rude and unprofessional. She also recounted a body-shaming episode in the South industry, where she was told they needed a 'fuller' person for a role. Irani expressed frustration with the industry's attitude and the pressure to conform to specific body standards. Her courageous revelations highlight ongoing issues of exploitation and discrimination in the film industry.

a20d2

Sanaya Irani described a specific incident where she was told by a Bollywood director, 'I am making this big film, there are many big heroes in it, and you must wear a bikini.' This reflects the pressure she faced to conform to specific roles in the industry.

Irani recounted feeling compelled to call the director due to pressure from his secretary, who warned her, 'Please sir will get angry, just speak to him once,' highlighting the coercive dynamics often present in the industry.
